entry.title: Hapi.js
entry.summary: Hapi.js is a web framework for node by the guys over at wallmart labs. It's configuration heavy, meaning config over convention, and incredibly adaptable and flexible. I think it's an amazing framework that needs to be covered more.

entry.title: Node.js in production
entry.summary: How is your company using Node.js in production and what is your experience? What was your stack before starting Node? What changed for the better and what does not work for you?

entry.title: Meteor
entry.summary: What is Meteor, what's different to other Frameworks.

entry.summary: Framework vuejs experiences, how-to, best practices, etc

entry.title: Streams 3
entry.summary: I would be interested in an in-depth look at Streams 3, which are coming with node 0.12

entry.title: Browserify vs RequireJS
entry.summary:
JS modules:
Browserify allows CommonJS `require()` and npm package consumption.
RequireJS allows AMD standard modules and in-browser loading.
Fight!

entry.title: AngularJS beyond Todo apps
entry.summary: War stories about AngularJS in more complex applications. What are the Gotchas etc.

entry.title: Scala.js
entry.summary:
I would like to hear from our functional neighbor Scala and how it translates to JavaScript. Details:
http://www.scala-js.org/

entry.title: Documentation Generators Best Practices
entry.summary:
It's difficult to choose the right tool to generate a documentation from the comments in your Javascript. Each tool has its own advantages and disadvantages and once you've decided for one your stuck forever with its syntax rules.
Either the tool's are designed for a slight different purpose (YUIDoc, JSDuck) or they might be a little hackish and lack some polish in the generated documents (JSDoc).
It would be great to learn about the experiences in adopting such a documentation generator in real projects.

entry.title: Testing node.js code
entry.summary: Automated tests are an essential part of any good software system. I would love to see some test frameworks in action (especially Mocha) and hear opinions about how, what and what not to do.

entry.title: Prototyping with Hoodie and Angular
entry.summary: Getting from zero to deployed prototype with user login. And yes, why not the todo app, would be interested in learning about workflow, used tools and configuration.

entry.title: D3 Deep Dive
entry.summary: Learn by some practical examples on how to build great looking visualizations on (complex?) data structures by leveraging the D3.js library. Give an outlook on how would one create components which can be reused on multiple contexts / pages.

entry.summary: Developing WebRTC applications, use cases, experiences, examples, best practices, etc..

entry.title: Grunt vs. Gulp
entry.summary: Strengths, weaknesses, differences between the two popular js task runners.

entry.title: Structuring larger JS codebases
entry.summary: What are current recommendations for keeping middle to larger JavaScript code bases maintainable? Give some real world examples on grouping functionality to modules and also on which aspects should be tested.
